options.name: Beginner Piercer
options.description: Gain +1 Attack and +1 Damage with Piercing Weapons. Gain a Fighting Stance.

options.name: Reaction : Flank
options.description: When an Allied Creature makes a Melee Attack against a target within your Melee Range, you can make an Attack against that same target with a 1d4 Bonus.

options.name: Novice Piercer
options.description: Gain +1 Attack with Piercing Weapons and Learn a Fighting Stance from the Stance Table

options.name: Free Action : Puncture
options.description: After hitting a Character with a Piercing Weapon, force the target to roll a Resilience  Check against your total Damage dealt after Mitigation. If the target fails, they gain the Bleeding Condition

options.name: Action : Thrust
options.description: Make a normal Attack. Your next Attack with this same Weapon has a +2 Bonus to Attack until the start of your next turn regardless if your first Attack hits.

options.name: Journeyman Piercer
options.description: Gain +1 Attack with Piercing Weapons and gain access to the Attack of Opportunity Reaction

options.name: Reaction : Reactive Toss
options.description: When a Creature moves within 4 Units of you, you can throw a Light Piercing Weapon at them.

options.name: Action : Impale
options.description: You make an Attack against a Creature with a Heavy Piercing Weapon. The Creature must make an Acrobatics or Athletics check against your Strength Modifier. If they fail, they cannot move until the end of their next turn or you make another Attack with the same Weapon.

options.name: Expert Piercer
options.description: Gain Critical Hits and +1 Attack with Piercing Weapons

options.name: Action : Flurry
options.description: Make 3 Attacks with the same Piercing Weapon, but each Attack has a -2 Modifier to each Attack and cannot True Hit.

options.name: Action : Power Toss
options.description: Make a Throwing Weapon Attack with a 1 Handed Piercing Weapon at a -2 Modifier that is upgraded to a True Hit if it hits the Target.

options.name: Master Piercer
options.description: Gain Brutal Critical Hits with Piercing Weapons and Gain +1 Attack with Piercing Weapons

options.name: Action : Multi-thrust
options.description: Make 2 Attacks with a Piercing Weapon, each with a +2 Attack Bonus. If both Attacks hit, the Target gains the Bleeding Condition.

options.name: Grandmaster Piercer
options.description: Your Damage Die for Piercing Weapons are upgraded (1-Handed Light: 2d6, 1-Handed Heavy: 2d8, 2-Handed Light: 3d6, 2-Handed Heavy: 3d8)
